Package com.api.hub.ai.starter.impl

Class StatelessEnvironmentHandler

java.lang.Object
com.api.hub.ai.starter.impl.EnvironmentLoader
com.api.hub.ai.starter.impl.StatelessEnvironmentHandler
All Implemented Interfaces:
MarkerConstants, Environment
@Component @ConditionalOnBean(Cache.class) @ConditionalOnProperty(name="env.handler.default", havingValue="true") public class StatelessEnvironmentHandler extends EnvironmentLoader
The StatelessEnvironmentHandler is the default implementation of the AI Agent Framework's Environment interface.

This class processes incoming user inputs and delegates execution to appropriate agents using a stateless, pluggable architecture. The handler works in a goal-task-action loop and manages agent selection, invocation, and action history tracking.

The framework architecture follows the pattern: StatelessEnvironmentHandler → EnvironmentLoader → Environment. This design allows developers to provide their own implementation of the `process` method by extending EnvironmentLoader and setting the property env.handler.default=false in the application configuration.

This implementation is only loaded if a Cache bean is available in the context and the property env.handler.default=true is set.

See Also:

  • Method Details

    • process

      public boolean process(EnvironmentState env, String userResponse, InputOutputHandler handler)
      Processes the user input within the AI agent environment. This method orchestrates task creation, agent selection, agent invocation, and action history tracking in a stateless manner.

      The method performs the following:

      • Fetches the AgentPool from the application context.
      • Resolves the current Goal from the environment.
      • Creates a new Task from user input.
      • Finds the best matching AgentDefination for the task.
      • Creates a State object, invokes the agent, and tracks all performed actions.
      • Repeats the loop if agent signals continuation.
      Parameters:
      env - The current EnvironmentState, containing goal queue, agent history, and configuration.
      userResponse - The user's textual input, which is wrapped into a task.
      handler - The InputOutputHandler for managing input/output during agent invocation.
      Returns:
      true if processing completed successfully; false otherwise.
